`hermod` is the next-generation cluster tools for DIDE, we hope it will provide a simpler interface to use the cluster from your laptops.

# Telling us about you and your computer

```r
hermod_init()
hermod_configure(
  username = "rfitzjoh",
  home = "~/net/home",
  temp = "~/net/temp",
  cluster = "sk")
```

# A simple example

This example shows the simplest thing you could do.

```r
t <- obj$enqueue(sessionInfo())
t$task_status()
t$task_wait(timeout = 10)
```

```r
hermod_init()

id <- hermod_task_create_explicit(quote(sessionInfo()))
didehpc_task_submit(id)
didehpc_task_status(id)
didehpc_task_wait(id, timeout = 10)
```

```r
t <- hermod_task_handle(id)
t$task_status()
t$task_wait(timeout = 10)
```

```r
hermod_task_create_auto(sessionInfo())
hermod_task_create_auto(sqrt(a) * b) # analyse the expression, export a and b
hermod_lapply(f, args)
hermod_bulk(f, args)
hermod_call(f, args)
```
